sub_topic: Finding the average value of a trigonometric function
message_1: A sine function has a maximum value of 4 and a minimum value of -2. Find the average value of the function over one period.
message_2:
To find the average value of the function over one period, we can simply take the average of the maximum and minimum values.

Average value = (Maximum value + Minimum value) / 2

Average value = (4 + (-2)) / 2

Average value = (4 - 2) / 2

Average value = 2 / 2

Average value = 1

The average value of the function over one period is 1.
